questions.prompt: Do you take a daily personal inventory?
questions.help: Step Ten is about maintaining what we've built.

questions.prompt: When during the day do you take your inventory? (morning, evening, both)
questions.help: Establish a consistent practice.

questions.prompt: What format do you use? (written, mental, prayer, etc.)
questions.help: Find what works best for you.

questions.prompt: Describe a situation today where you felt angry or afraid.
questions.help: When we're disturbed, we can pause and check ourselves.

questions.prompt: What was your part in this situation?
questions.help: Look at your own behavior, not others'.

questions.prompt: Which character defect showed up? (selfishness, dishonesty, fear, etc.)
questions.help: Awareness helps us change.

questions.prompt: What could you have done differently?
questions.help: Consider healthier responses.

questions.prompt: Do you need to make an immediate amend?
questions.help: Promptly admitting when we're wrong keeps us free.

questions.prompt: What did you do well today?
questions.help: Acknowledge your successes and progress.

questions.prompt: Where did you fall short today?
questions.help: Honesty without harsh self-judgment.

questions.prompt: Did you harm anyone today?
questions.help: If so, plan to make amends promptly.

questions.prompt: Were you kind, loving, and helpful today?
questions.help: Consider how you treated others.

questions.prompt: Did you practice spiritual principles? (honesty, open-mindedness, willingness, etc.)
questions.help: Recovery is about how we live.

questions.prompt: What are your warning signs that you're getting off track?
questions.help: Restlessness, irritability, and discontent are common.

questions.prompt: What do you do when you notice these warning signs?
questions.help: Quick action prevents bigger problems.

questions.prompt: Are you holding onto any resentments?
questions.help: Resentments are the number one offender.

questions.prompt: What can you do to let go of this resentment?
questions.help: Prayer for the other person often helps.

questions.prompt: How has your daily inventory practice helped your recovery?
questions.help: Reflect on the benefits.

questions.prompt: What patterns have you noticed through regular inventory?
questions.help: Self-awareness leads to change.

questions.prompt: How has Step Ten changed your relationships?
questions.help: Promptly admitting wrongs builds trust.

questions.prompt: Are you experiencing more peace and serenity?
questions.help: This is a promise of daily practice.

questions.prompt: What improvements do you want to make in your Step Ten practice?
questions.help: We can always deepen our spiritual practice.
